Description

We are all Homo sapiens (Stringer, Chris, ). By exploring our search for the earliest common ancestor with Homo neanderthalensis (Stringer, Chris, ), we can deepen our understanding of our species' family tree. While this may seem like a simplification, it clearly demonstrates our shared humanity.

Animal evolution unfolds over vast stretches of time, punctuated by occasional bursts of rapid change (Sperling, Erik A., et Richard G. Stockey, , pp. 605-622). In contrast, the evolution of language progresses swiftly (Fitch, W.T., , 3-33). This rapid linguistic evolution enables us to categorize and label groups of people and events, inadvertently fostering the perception of differences among us.

Some previously published families have been temporarily hidden until the standardization process is complete. Although they are not currently visible here, they remain available in the GitHub repository (History Tracers, Github).

The events can be updated or added at any time based on new research.

value.name: American Indigenous Peoples
value.desc: communities and Civilizations that inhabited the Americas for thousands of years prior to European colonization.

value.name: Enslaved people
value.desc: study of the slavery system across different centuries.

value.name: Holy Office Familiars
value.desc: these individuals enjoyed various privileges and formed a kind of "third order" within the Inquisition (Saraiva, Antonio Jos√©, 1969, pp. 240 - 243). This section lists those who applied to become Familiars and underwent thorough investigations into their family background before being accepted or rejected.

value.name: Muslims
value.desc: historical events in which Muslim families, or individuals with Muslim ancestry, take center stage.

value.name: People Defamed as Jews
value.desc: this term refers to individuals who, despite lacking recent Jewish ancestry, were nonetheless labeled as Jews by others. The concept of defamation originates from the Inquisition era and should not be used in the same way today.

value.name: Persecution of Jews
value.desc: this link provides an overview of various instances of Jewish persecution throughout history, offering valuable insight into these significant events.
